pr_title: [thing] Dynamic state/command provider should not return original description

timeline.message:
Clarify return values for implementation

Signed-off-by: Christoph Weitkamp <github@christophweitkamp.de>

Dynamic state/command provider should not return original descritpion

Signed-off-by: Christoph Weitkamp <github@christophweitkamp.de>

timeline.bodyText: Question is if we should just ignore these wrong implementations in bindings or if we should throw an exception here and force the developer to fix it.
timeline.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: Being completely silent about it doesn't feel right. Would the exception be thrown every time the state options are accessed? If so, that could result in a lot of exceptions. Maybe just log it instead?
replies.author: mhilbush

replies.bodyText: I added a ERROR log message.
replies.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: Can you also update the JavaDocs of these providers for the fact that if the result is not null it should not be the original object?
replies.author: wborn

replies.bodyText: Great! Also nice to see some unit tests for this. 👍
replies.author: wborn

timeline.message:
Added ERROR log message

Signed-off-by: Christoph Weitkamp <github@christophweitkamp.de>

Added integration test for CommandDescriptionProvider

Signed-off-by: Christoph Weitkamp <github@christophweitkamp.de>
